name: slurper.vim
description:
slurper.vim (http://github.com/alowe/vim-slurper) was written as a companion to the slurper gem. The slurper gem allows you compose stories in a plain text file and then slurp them into Pivotal Tracker (http://www.pivotaltracker.com) through the api in bulk. For more information on the gem check out its homepage (http://github.com/hashrocket/slurper).

slurper.vim provides macros for generating chore, feature, release, and bug story templates in the correct format to speed up your story writing even further. It also provides basic syntax highlighting for .slurper files.

Usage

CTRL-h generates a new chore and puts you in insert mode on the name line.

  ==
  story_type:
    chore
  name:

  description:

  labels:

CTRL-j generates a new feature and puts you in insert mode on the name line.

  ==
  story_type:
    feature
  name:

  description:
    In order to
    As a
    I want

    -

  labels:

CTRL-k generates a new release and puts you in insert mode on the name line.

  ==
  story_type:
    release
  name:

  description:

  labels:

CTRL-l generates a new bug and puts you in insert mode on the name line.

  ==
  story_type:
    bug
  name:

  description:

  labels:

The macros work the same in insert or edit modes.
install_details:
Copy slurper.vim files into their corresponding folders within your .vim directory.

or my preferred method of installing vim plugins is to use Tim Pope's pathogen.vim plugin.

http://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=2332

versions.release_notes: Force 2 spaces for tab in .slurper files
Support chores, features, releases and bugs. Updated story format to match version 0.3.0 of the slurper gem.
Added syntax highlighting and updated key maps to be less obtrusive.
